value.title: Get into data analysis with a Excel, Power BI, and Python course bundle
value.excerpt: It aims to teach you how to harness, analyze, and draw insight from data using Python, Power BI, and Excel. As you jump from one course to another, you'll learn what Python is and why it was ...

value.title: Power BI + Dremio = A Seamless BI Experience for Cloud Data Lakes
value.excerpt: With the continuing rise of the public cloud, many companies are now centralizing their data in massive cloud data warehouses and data lakes powered by storage services, such as Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS). The challenge is to deliver insights on these data warehouses and data lakes rapidly and cost-efficiently.

value.title: Certified and Promoted reports and apps
value.excerpt: A key enabler for a data culture is the pervasive availability of standardized, authoritative data that represents a single source of truth, enabling users to make decisions based on trusted data.

value.title: Announcing Power BI Connector to Azure Databricks Public Preview
value.excerpt: We are excited to announce the public preview of the Azure Databricks connector. You can now share your Power BI reports based on Azure Databricks with others by publishing them in the Power BI service.

value.title: Learn about Power BI Organizational data types in Excel on October 29th
value.excerpt: Join the Excel and Power BI teams live on LinkedIn Oct 29th at 8:30AM PST to learn about organizational data types that appear in Excel.

value.title: Power BI Report Server October 2020 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: We are excited to bring you a new version of Power BI Report Server this month! With this update, weâ€™re releasing an awesome set of features including the modern ribbon, slicer improvements, enhanced dataset metadata and more. Read on to get the full details of all the new additions.

value.title: Priority Access sign-up for Power BI Premium per user public preview now available
value.excerpt: We are almost ready to launch the public preview of the new Power BI Premium per user SKU in early to mid-November.Â  We are excited to give users access to these capabilities as soon as possible, while at the same time ensuring that we are prioritizing the users/tenants that are most interested in previewing

value.title: The enhanced compute engine is now enabled by default
value.excerpt: The enhanced compute engine will be enabled for all new dataflows workloads

value.title: Updates to Power BI Publish to web for better public reporting
value.excerpt: Power BI Publish to web helps organizations share data on public websites, enabling communities to stay informed. Learn how you can make your reports load faster for users, and provide improved experiences in the event your report experiences heavy usage.

value.title: Join us! Thursday October 22 Power Platform Community Conference
value.excerpt: We are thrilled to come together with you to host another online Power Platform Community Conference this year! Click here for more details.

value.title: Announcing Personalize Visuals General Availability (GA)
value.excerpt: Back in May, we released a public preview of a new personalize visuals experience. With this new capability, you can empower your end-users to explore and personalize visuals all within the consumption view of a report. For example, your end-user can change a measure, a dimension, or the visualization

value.title: Announcing improved MDX query performance in Power BI
value.excerpt: With a recent update of the Analysis Services Tabular engine in Power BI, Multidimensional Expressions (MDX) clients, such as Microsoft Excel, can now enjoy improved query performance against datasets in Power BI.
